initial.title: Step 0: Initial State
initial.description:
LRU (Least Recently Used) replaces the page that has not been used for the longest time.

Core Rules:
- Replace least recently USED page (not just loaded)
- Initial queue order: By load time (oldest first)
- On page HIT: Move accessed frame to back (MRU position)
- On page FAULT: Front of queue is victim (LRU)

We have {num_frames} frames with initial pages: {frame_list}

order_queue.title: Step 1: Order Queue by Load Time
order_queue.description:
First, we order the frame queue by load time (oldest first).

This establishes the initial LRU order - the frame loaded first is considered least recently used.

Queue order (LRU to MRU): {queue_order}

The frame at the front is the LRU candidate for replacement.

page_hit.title: Step {step}: Page {page} - HIT
page_hit.description:
Page {page} is requested.

Page {page} is already in Frame {frame_id}.

Result: PAGE HIT - No replacement needed.

IMPORTANT: Unlike FIFO, in LRU a hit UPDATES the queue!
Frame {frame_id} moves to the back of the queue (MRU position).

This refresh means Frame {frame_id} is now the most recently used.

page_fault.title: Step {step}: Page {page} - FAULT
page_fault.description:
Page {page} is requested.

Page {page} is NOT in memory.

Result: PAGE FAULT - Replacement needed.

Victim Selection: Frame {victim_frame} (front of queue = LRU)
Old page {old_page} is replaced with new page {page}.

Queue Update: Frame {victim_frame} moves to the back (now MRU).
